channel.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
channel.description: Im getting an Xbox 360 S with 4gb memory, and I can't find a list of compatible flash drives for extra memory that I could buy at say Walmart or Best Buy. Can anyone help me?

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:12, topic:375594”][quote author=.Unlimited link=topic=471529.msg3449926#msg3449926 date=1293673065]

You can only use them for gamesaves & profiles. Game updates and downloaded things have to be saved to the hard drive. So depending on what you plan to do/play, it may be best to get a larger hard drive.

And

Pretty sure you can use any flash drive

I have the old xbox and I use my flashdrive for game saves, game updates all that stuff. I’ve even downloaded game demos to it and played them.
[/quote]
Really? I have a 6gb flash drive that I always have plugged into an xbox (400k gamerscore, 135mb profile, and 2 houses/xboxs, so i cba to recover every time), and every time I go to download a game update or demo to it, my xbox basically tells me to fuck off. I can save/transfer/mod game saves and profiles on it fine though.[/quote]
I just use a 8gb one and I have it plugged in in the port in the back next to the ethernet port if that changes anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=".Unlimited, post:11, topic:375594"][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=471529.msg3448706#msg3448706 date=1293592522]
You can only use them for gamesaves & profiles. Game updates and downloaded things have to be saved to the hard drive. So depending on what you plan to do/play, it may be best to get a larger hard drive.

And

Pretty sure you can use any flash drive

[/quote]
I have the old xbox and I use my flashdrive for game saves, game updates all that stuff. I’ve even downloaded game demos to it and played them.[/quote]
Really? I have a 6gb flash drive that I always have plugged into an xbox (400k gamerscore, 135mb profile, and 2 houses/xboxs, so i cba to recover every time), and every time I go to download a game update or demo to it, my xbox basically tells me to fuck off. I can save/transfer/mod game saves and profiles on it fine though.

Read full topic

And

[quote author=.Unlimited link=topic=471529.msg3448688#msg3448688 date=1293591609]

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Really, is it that hardcore? I haven’t looked at the slims, but its much easier than that on the old ones.

Sucksforslimowners if that really is the case.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:6, topic:375594”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=471529.msg3449013#msg3449013 date=1293607774]
you can’t just purchase a low brand laptop hard drive and put it in, instead, Microsoft is forcing people to buy an Official Hard Drive.
[/quote]

What’s stopping you?[/quote]
Some bullshit checks they do. Computer hard drives, external hard drives, they all work. You just need to do that Jtag exploit and remove the checks before they will.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

A hard drive is a hard drive. They’re pretty much all the same.

They tell you that because they want you to buy their overpriced hard drives, not because it won’t actually work.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:6, topic:375594”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=471529.msg3449013#msg3449013 date=1293607774]
you can’t just purchase a low brand laptop hard drive and put it in, instead, Microsoft is forcing people to buy an Official Hard Drive.
[/quote]

What’s stopping you?[/quote]
It won’t save the data correctly, it’s the way they are programmed I’m guessing.

I just know thats what their support told me when I asked about switching my stuff to a portable hard drive and saving to the new xbox, but they told me that.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Explisionist:

you can’t just purchase a low brand laptop hard drive and put it in, instead, Microsoft is forcing people to buy an Official Hard Drive.

What’s stopping you?

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

The hard drive that is included in the unit can be taken out and be replaced. you can’t just purchase a low brand laptop hard drive and put it in, instead, Microsoft is forcing people to buy an Official Hard Drive.

There is no announcement at all on the hard drive that can be used on the Slim ones. I know that it’s coming since you can take out the hard drive on the Slim unit and replace it with another.

If I am correct Microsoft did release a hard drive you can buy separately and connect to it with a USB cord? Or else just buy the 250GB one.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Slim flash drives
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well, some flash drives won’t work - because the console runs some read/write tests on it to see if it is quick enough - if it isn’t, it won’t allow you to use it.

Read full topic
